summary.p: #60. a) PIM; b) on the northern wall (outer side) of the first maṇḍapa when we enter, near the well; on the eastern side of the group of three inscriptions; c) personally located and read in situ; d) Tyagarajan (2014: no. 12, 149 [fragment 1]); e) lost; f) lost; g) inscription not read with anyone; h) fragment; the last line is intriguing: śrī uttamacōḻatēvarai tiruvayiṟu vā is the beginning of the formula which refers to Cempiyaṉ Mahādevī = śrī uttamacōḻatēvarai tiruvayiṟu vāytta pirāṭṭiyār (for other variants, see Cane 2017: 122). Unfortunately, we can no longer read it, and there is no estampage because it was not noticed in the AREs. Although it is impossible to verify, the few letters that we can still guess today do match the edition of Tyagarajan. May it be the beginning of another inscription which was engraved in continuation? Or a part of the same inscription which refers to different donations?
